This is obviously sarcasm illustrating some people's illogical thought processes. Copernicus did indeed state that the sun was the center of the universe. People believed him. However, he was proven wrong eventually. But proving a theory wrong does not automatically prove another right.
 Many creationism supporters argue that if evolution is wrong, then their creator designed everything the way it is 6000 or so yrs ago. Any scientist or student can tell you that nothing can be "proved" absolutely (except math/logic). The future may always hold better technology from which to discover something closer to the truth. This does not mean in any way that creationism has merit.
 Creationism seems to rely on irrational beliefs and thoughts, logical fallacies, ignorance and sometimes outright lying to support it. Also, personal incredulity is never evidence that you're right. Why would they need these tactics if creationism had merit?
 Seriously, attempting to explain rational thought to an irrational person is virtually impossible. This is why mental health facilities sometimes sedate their patients. If you're using logical thought to convince someone who cannot, it just won't work. They may even appear to be intelligent, but intelligence does not always imply rationalism.
